reviews.review_msg: Doug is a very particular professor. Stick to the information taught in lectures, actively listen, and do the homework to obtain a desirable grade. He's not as bad as some people make him to be, though I personally dislike his views.

This isn't an easy class, especially as a first year. I enjoyed lectures and tutorials, but I felt as if there as something missing when it came to the teaching. If you work hard, do a lot of practice questions, you'll definitely pass but you'll have to work even for that. If you need this class just be ready to work hard, but you'll be fine!

Has a horrible textbook that's hard to understand sometimes cuz he wrote it himself. His tests are hard and weekly problem sets are annoying. He's nice though, just kinda mid. If your gonna take this class do a LOT of work.

The textbook he made us buy was so useless and confusing, the complete opposite of "getting to the point." His lectures are very hard to understand as he expects us to think exactly like him. You got to grind extremely hard in order to only get a decent mark in his class. He's very passionate about economics, almost too passionate...

Not a bad guy, but he's not suited to teaching. Uses his own textbook he wrote but that textbook is very unclear. Tests are confusing because even though he gives us practice questions from his textbook, it doesn't feel like they relate on tests. He also uses a lot of references, so if you don't get them you don't understand.

Loved him. He explained one of the midterm questions in easy English (since it's not my first language) and gave us prayer accommodation during the final. He has incredible lectures, and this class is  doable if you stay on top of things. People who dislike him probably don't study and don't try to show up in class.
he made fun of me when i went for help he is incoherent and hard to follow and the text book makes no sense...i guess thats what happens when you publish it online.

Josh made microeconomics very accessible and at times entertaining. He doesn't require a textbook, and his notes are ridiculously detailed (too much even). Take solid notes and you should be fine. A warning however, his exams are tough, and you won't do well if you're the "walk into lecture half an hour late in pyjama pants" type.

If you are like me and taking this course is not a requirement, I don't recommend taking it. The problem is the weighting in this class is awful. That combined with him being a hard grader, the exams being difficult and a big part of your mark makes it hard to do well. My classes average was in the 50's for both the midterm and final.
he's whatever. There is way to much material to remember, exams are open book and laptop but still tough as the average was in the 50s.
bad accent, bad teaching method, bad bad bad!!! too much notes, hard final...unclear lectures, bad writings....
Lectures arent mandatory so just grind out the textbook and tutorial problems and you should be fine. If you are going to lectures bring a pillow or sum
Gulriz is a nice person but her testing is not. Mt 1 was too long as it was the length of a final exam (she only gave us 2 hours). Not only that, lectures are too boring. Don't recommend her.

Professor Barkin, is a nice professor, although her lectures are confusing and hard to understand a some points. The book is more useful than her lecture slides, so don't skip on getting the book. She is much better in office hours and will work through each problem with you in detail.
No bueno.

She takes so much time in explaining concepts that should've been explained quickly. she is very repetitive and doesn't easily get to the point. overall, her lectures are uninteresting and you can get easily get sidetracked.  

make sure to read the textbooks and do a lot of practice.

Had Gulriz Summer 2014 for Econ 103, and took econ 201 in the fall with her. She is a great prof I don't know what everyone else is saying. These are fundamental courses in economics, and if you work hard and follow the book and her lecture notes hand in hand you will do well. Just have to beat the average.

Not an easy class, you have to work for it. Lots of reading from the textbook, lectures are long, sometimes boring. Her explanations are often unclear and broad, depending on your TA the tutorials are worth it. Final and midterm were ok, homework isnt too bad

Good prof for 103,  very different for 201. Some people find her confusing, its just because she has so many ideas in her head but can't get them out properly. Only talks in one tone of voice .  Midterms were fair, final was fair. Overall average- good course and prof.

Boring. Do not go to class, you'll learn more about Microeconomics from the textbook--class will just confuse you. She's so bad, that after her class, I ended up transferring to UBC, because apparently, SFU Econ is a joke. Waste of my time and money.
One of the best prof in SFU, he's the most caring, kind and understanding prof ever
Good prof overall.
long midterms

doesn't provide lectures slides, all notes are handwritten so hard to keep up with what hes saying and writing. is not accessible at all. had such a bad experience in the first 3 weeks that i had to drop the class with a wd rather than stick with it.

She's a decent Professor. She's definitely tough with the questions she asks on her exams. Her questions are much tougher then what she goes over in class. You really have to apply the knowledge to get a good mark. It's a tough class regardless.  No need to buy a book for her class. Midterms were hard. Final was fairer.  The curve saves you tho.
